Publications

Journal Articles

  1. Masuda, S., & Ikegai, M. (2024). An empirical analysis of learning and forgetting mechanisms in repeated evacuations: A panel recursive logit approach. Transportmetrica B: Transport Dynamics, 12(1).
  2. 増田慧樹, & 羽藤英二 (2024). 多期間展開ゲームに基づく立地行動モデルを用いた事前復興インセンティブの最適設計. 都市計画論文集, 59(3), pp.1091-1098.
    Masuda, S., & Hato, E. (2024). Optimal incentive design of pre-disaster urban planning based on location choice modeling with extensive-form game. Journal of the City Planning Institute of Japan, 59(3), pp.1091-1098.
  3. Ikegai, M., Hidaka, K., & Masuda, S. (2024). Short-term panel data analysis of the effect of flood risk communication on individual evacuation decisions. International Journal of Disaster Risk Reduction, 106, 104433.
  4. Hidaka, K., Ikegai, M., & Masuda, S. (2024). Regression modeling of subjective probability of river inundation with epistemic uncertainty: a short-term panel data analysis. Natural Hazards, 1-33.
  5. 増田慧樹, 羽藤英二, 小関玲奈, & 飯塚卓哉 (2022). 再帰ロジットを援用した復興都市計画のパレートフロンティア分析. 交通工学論文集, 8(1), pp.11-20.
    Masuda, S., Hato, E., Koseki, R., & Iizuka, T. (2022). Pareto frontier analysis of reconstruction city planning using recursive logit model. JSTE Journal of Traffic Engineering, 8(1), pp.11-20.
  6. 増田慧樹, & 池内幸司 (2022). 大規模水害時における孤立病院からの入院患者の救助時間短縮方法の提案. 災害情報, 20(1), pp.75-85.
    Masuda, S., & Ikeuchi, K. (2022). Proposal of Methods to Shorten the Rescue Time for Inpatients from Inundated Hospital during a Large-Scale Flood. Journal of disaster information studies, 20(1), pp.75-85.

Conference Presentations (Peer-Reviewed)

  1. Masuda, S.* & Hato, E. (Dec 8-9, 2025). Estimating Behavioral Urban Dynamics under Strategic Interaction: A Game-Theoretic Approach to Transport and Development Policy, The 29th International Conference of Hong Kong Society for Transporation Studies (HKSTS), Hong Kong.
  2. Masuda, S.* & Hato, E. (Nov 19-21, 2025). Predictive Traffic Control for Evacuation Contraflow using ZDD Sampling, IEEE 28th International Conference on Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITSC), Gold Coast, Australia.
  3. Masuda, S.* & Hato, E. (Dec 9-10, 2024). Dynamic reconfiguration strategies for managing shelter and road congestion in urban emergency evacuations, The 28th International Conference of Hong Kong Society for Transporation Studies (HKSTS), Hong Kong.
  4. Masuda, S.* & Hato, E. (Sept 2-4, 2024). Combinatorial reconfiguration problem based on MFD for evacuation management under disasters, TRC-30 (30th Anniversary of Transportation Research Part C), Crete, Greece.
  5. Masuda, S.* & Hato, E. (Dec 11-12, 2023). Dynamic Optimization of Transportation Infrastructure Investment based on Subgame Perfect Equilibrium, The 27th International Conference of Hong Kong Society for Transporation Studies (HKSTS), Hong Kong.

  7. Masuda, S.*, Iizuka, T., & Hato, E. (December 12-15, 2022). A dynamic activity scheduling model for correcting fatalities’ non-response bias in tsunami evacuation, The 16th International Conference on Travel Behavior Research (IATBR), Santiago, Chile.
  8. Masuda, S.* & Hato, E. (September 21-23, 2022). Evacuation choice modeling using reinforcement learning based on the multi-armed bandit problem, The 12th International Conference of the International Society for the Integrated Disaster Risk Management (IDRiM), Online.
  9. Masuda, S.* & Hato, E. (June 19-25, 2022). Macroscopic network design for dynamic evacuation scheduling with MFD-based assignment using the recursive logit model, The 11th Triennial Symposium on Transportation Analysis conference (TRISTAN), Mauritius Island.
  10. Masuda, S.*, Koseki R., & Hato, E. (2022 (accepted)). Evacuation Network Design with a Dynamic Scheduling Model: Pareto Frontier Analysis for Historic Tsunami Recovery Urban Planning, The 101st TRB Annual Meeting.
  11. Masuda, S.*, Hato, E., Koseki R., & Iizuka, T. (September 22-24, 2021). Cliometric analysis with a pareto frontier of urban planning after the Chile tsunami, The 11th International Conference of the International Society for the Integrated Disaster Risk Management, Online.
